docs.snippet: LJUBLJANA, Jugoslavia, May 18 (UPI) The Soviet Union, an upset loser in the first round to Brazil, routed Uruguay, 95-43, today in a third-round game of the world amateur basketball championship. It was the Soviet's second triumph.
docs.lead_paragraph: LJUBLJANA, Jugoslavia, May 18 (UPI) The Soviet Union, an upset loser in the first round to Brazil, routed Uruguay, 95-43, today in a third-round game of the world amateur basketball championship. It was the Soviet's second triumph.

headline.main: SOVIET FIVE TOPS URUGUAY, 95-43; Gains 50-32 Half-Time Lead in World Tournament

docs.snippet: LJUBLJANA, Yugoslavia, Ma 20 (A.P) Ken Washington of the University of California, Los Angeles scored 3 points in the closing seconds today giving the United States a 75-72 victory over the Soviet Union in the world amateur basketball tournament.
docs.lead_paragraph: LJUBLJANA, Yugoslavia, Ma 20 (A.P) Ken Washington of the University of California, Los Angeles scored 3 points in the closing seconds today giving the United States a 75-72 victory over the Soviet Union in the world amateur basketball tournament.

headline.main: WASHINGTON GETS 3 DECIDING POINTS; U.C.L.A. Star Sparks Rally to Erase 72-68 Deficit Loss Is 2d for Russians

docs.snippet: LJUBLJANA, Yugoslavia, May 21 (UPI) Renzo Bariviera scored with six seconds remaining tonight, enabling Italy to upset the United States, 66-64, in the world basketball championship. It was the Americans' first loss.
docs.lead_paragraph: LJUBLJANA, Yugoslavia, May 21 (UPI) Renzo Bariviera scored with six seconds remaining tonight, enabling Italy to upset the United States, 66-64, in the world basketball championship. It was the Americans' first loss.

headline.main: U.S. FIVE IS UPSET BY ITALY, 66-64; Americans Handed First Loss in World Tourney
YUGOSLAVIA TOPS U.S. FIVE BY 70-63; Clinches World Crown as Americans Drop 2d Game

docs.snippet: LJUBLJANA, Yugoslavia, May 24 (UPI) Brazil handed the United States its second straight defeat today, 69-65, to gain second place in the world basketball championship.
docs.lead_paragraph: LJUBLJANA, Yugoslavia, May 24 (UPI) Brazil handed the United States its second straight defeat today, 69-65, to gain second place in the world basketball championship.

headline.main: BRAZIL FIVE DEFEATS U.S. FOR. 2D PLACE

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, May 29 (AP) A band of urban guerrillas overpowered personnel at a Uruguayan naval training center here today and fled with more than 700 weapons and a large quantity of ammunition.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, May 29 (AP) A band of urban guerrillas overpowered personnel at a Uruguayan naval training center here today and fled with more than 700 weapons and a large quantity of ammunition.
docs.abstract: Tupamaros faction, believed to consist of anarchists, raids naval training center, Montevideo, escaping with over 700 weapons and large quantity of ammunition

headline.main: GUERRILLAS SEIZE ARMS IN URUGUAY; Band Raids Naval Training Center in Montevideo

docs.snippet: MEXICO CITY, May 30 The ninth world soccer championship begins here tomorrow when the Mexican national team plays the Soviet Union at Aztec Stadium.

headline.main: Host Mexico Opposes Soviet Union Today in World Cup Soccer Opener; 16 TEAMS DIVIDED INTO FOUR GROUPS Italy, Brazil, Uruguay Seek to Retire Cup by Winning World Title Third Time

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, May 31 (Reuters) Three terrorists were killed and a number were captured during gun battles with security forces early today as authorities pressed a hunt for guerrillas who raided a navy training center two days ago, official...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, May 31 (Reuters) Three terrorists were killed and a number were captured during gun battles with security forces early today as authorities pressed a hunt for guerrillas who raided a navy training center two days ago, official sources said.
docs.abstract: 3 terrorists killed in gun battles with security forces as search is intensifed for guerrillas who raided navy training center

headline.main: 3 Terrorists in Uruguay Die in Battles With Police

docs.snippet: Millions of soccer fans will be losing a lot of sleep this month, and Swedish sociologists fear families may be split up.
